review_title: Growth/ promotion opportunities for everyone, competitive pay, amazing team/ community support.
pros: I always looked forward to going to work each day at MSBR. The nature of the work is challenging, but that is the same anywhere in the field working with people who have experienced trauma. My supervisor really challenged me to grow and become a leader. When we were understaffed the team came together to show appreciation as I have never seen before.
cons: It's hard to not take things the boys do/ say personally (because we're all human) and that can wear on staff if they're not following their training/ protocols.

pros: Everyone is very nice and welcoming, one of the best places I've worked at.
cons: None that I can think of, other than it may be stressful for direct care staff.

pros: The kids and their varied personalities
cons: Admin lies, they care more about picking apart your every move! Can’t staff enough to approve vacations. Unless you’re their pet!

pros: They serve a vulnerable population. Provide a building and food for this precious clientele.  They work on providing safe transport to and from events.
cons: They focus to much on the bottom line.  They don't have a consistent continuity program for employees to refer for operational expectations.  Middle Management does not communicate and support lower shift supervisor.

job_title: Human Resources, Training, and Compliance Assistant in Spokane, WA
pros:
-Strong team environment
-Strong leadership and support from management and admin
-Flexible scheduling
-Good benefits
-Promotes from within
-Strong values
cons: -Can sometimes be a stressful work environment for direct care staff

pros: the boys are great and other employees
Free meals and plenty of down time
cons: Not enough support from upper management
